detailed_results.prompt: show me guidance sources you used in your answer
detailed_results.answer:
UK higher education admissions are primarily handled through the Universities and Colleges Admissions Service (UCAS), which provides a centralised application system and detailed information for prospective students, including entry requirements, course details, and application procedures. Individual universities also set their own admissions criteria and have their own websites with specific guidance. **Guidance Sources:**
**UCAS:** [https://www.ucas.com/](https://www.ucas.com/)
**Individual University Websites:** (Example: [https://www.ox.ac.uk/admissions](https://www.ox.ac.uk/admissions) for Oxford University)
_This answer isn't grounded to your knowledge base; refine or ask to search._.
